attributes.action: Reimburse 5% of NI Contributions for unattainable Dental Care Treatments
attributes.additional_details: NHS dental care exists only on paper. I have been unable to register with an NHS dentist for 2 years now - yet a private appointment I could get with 1 day's notice, therefore it is not a shortage of dentists, it is a broken system. I refuse to pay for services I am unable to access - I am happy to pay for them directly myself, privately, when the government stops charging me for them. If this was a privately run comapny, it would be labelled a scam.
attributes.background: Many people like myself have not been able to receive NHS dental treatments for years. Yet the government is still allegedly using National Insurance Contributions to fund them – I refuse to pay for something I do not have access to. I demand the funds to be reimbursed and the NI lowered.

rejection.details: Reduce NI payments for people not registered with an NHS dentist: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/741361
